intro: Calappa orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco calappa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
